meanings.definition: A group of yeomen or small landowners who serve as part-time soldiers.
meanings.sent1: The yeomanry gathered to train for their military duties.
meanings.sent2: The yeomanry were called upon to defend the village during times of need.
meanings.sent3: The yeomanry decided to have a friendly competition to see who could march the fastest.
meanings.sent4: In times of crisis, the yeomanry stood as a shield against any threats.
meanings.sent5: The image of the yeomanry in their uniforms was etched in the villagers' minds.

meanings.definition: The qualities or characteristics of a yeoman.
meanings.sent1: Honesty and hard work were the hallmarks of his yeomanry.
meanings.sent2: She embodied the yeomanry of old with her dedication to the land.
meanings.sent3: His sense of humor added a touch of yeomanry to the otherwise serious meeting.
meanings.sent4: The yeomanry of kindness and generosity shone through in her actions.
meanings.sent5: The yeomanry of integrity was evident in every decision he made.

meanings.sent1: The yeomanry assembled for their annual meeting to discuss community matters.
meanings.sent2: In times of celebration, the yeomanry came together to share stories and laughter.
meanings.sent3: The yeomanry decided to plant a community garden to benefit all.
meanings.sent4: The yeomanry of the town worked hand in hand to rebuild after the storm.
meanings.sent5: The yeomanry stood united, a symbol of strength and solidarity.
